message_1: Suppose you have a dataset with the following values: 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45, 50. Find the mean and median of the dataset.
message_2:
To find the mean of the dataset, we add up all the values and divide by the number of values:

Mean = (10 + 15 + 20 + 25 + 30 + 35 + 40 + 45 + 50) / 9
Mean = 270 / 9
Mean = 30

To find the median, we first make sure the dataset is in ascending order (which it is), and then find the middle value. Since there are 9 values, the median is the 5th value:

Median = 30

So, the mean and median of the dataset are both 30.
